thread.title: Trinity lineups finish 1st, 2nd at region meet
thread.title_full: Trinity lineups finish 1st, 2nd at region meet

title: Trinity lineups finish 1st, 2nd at region meet
text:
Trinity lineups finish 1st, 2nd at region meet Thursday, October 22, 2015 Comments 
LOGANVILLE - Coweta County runners dominated this year's GISA Region 1-AAA cross-country meet at Loganville Christian on Tuesday. 
Hans Troyer led a 1-2-3 individual finish for Trinity Christian's boys cross country team en route to winning the boys championship. 
Trinity's girls also advanced to this year's state championship meet by finishing second overall, while Heritage School teammates Sovi Wellons and Ashley Wood finished first and second, respectively, among individual finishers. 
Just an eighth grader, Wellons picked up where former Heritage standout runner Ruthie Powell left off last fall, giving the Lady Hawks another region champion with a time of 20:55. 
Wood, a senior, followed right behind her Heritage teammate with a runnerup finish in 21:45. Both runners for the Lady Hawks will advance to the GISA state meet on Oct. 31 at Darton College in Albany after being named All-State runners. 
Trinity teams also move on following respective efforts. The Lions dominated with a team score of 23, well ahead of Dominion Christian (63) and The Weber School (68). Holy Spirit was fourth with 100 and Heritage School's boys took fifth at 137 ahead of Griffin Christain (152). 
Troyer dominated individually among boys runners, winning an individual title in 17:47 among the first of three consecutive Lions to cross. Jacob Richardson finished as region runner-up in 18:27, while Adam Aycock placed third in 18:38. All three were named All-State for their efforts. Trinity coach Ryan Tipton was named Region 1-AAA Coach of the Year. 
All six of Trinity's boys runners placed among the top 20 finishers. David Freeman (6th, 19:09) and Chris Thomas (11th, 20:43) closed out the Lions' scoring, while Sawyer Stevens (14th, 21:01) and Ben Peacock (17th, 21:38) were close behind. 
Trinity Christian's girls were a close second behind Holy Spirit (47) with 56 points. The Lady Lions' five scorers all finished among the top-15 led by Faith Robertson's third-place individual effort. Robertson finished in 22:22 behind only Heritage's top duo. 
Teammates Emily Olson (11th, 24:09), Sami Bourque (13th, 24:26) , Claire Geerlings (14th, 24:27) and Grace Williams (15th, 24:41) were separated by a 32-second span to complete Trinity's scoring. Maggie Wheeler placed 29th for Trinity. 
Heritage's girls finished fourth with 72 points, just three behind Atlanta Girls. Catherine Hallman gave the Lady Hawks a third top-10 individual finisher while placing eighth overall in 23:38. Allie Browning and Ivie Cullen Dean crossed in 30th and 31st, respectively. 
Heritage's boys were led by Tom Pattiz's 13th place finish in 20:58. Gage Warren (28th, 22:28), Sam Martin (30th, 22:48), Jim Barber (31st, 22:49), Tripp Markel (35th, 25:22) and Addy Williams (36th, 27:52) competed for the Hawks. More
